gov.noaa.pmel.tmap.ferret.server.importer
Class MountDirHandle

java.lang.Object
  org.iges.anagram.Handle
      org.iges.anagram.DirHandle
          gov.noaa.pmel.tmap.ferret.server.importer.MountDirHandle
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class MountDirHandle
extends DirHandle

Represents a sub-directory of the server catalog. The content inside this directory is synched with the content in its corresponding file directory.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

MountDirHandle

public MountDirHandle(java.lang.String completeName,
                      java.io.File dir,
                      java.lang.String prefix,
                      java.lang.String suffix,
                      java.lang.String docURL,
                      java.lang.String userDAS,
                      java.lang.String format,
                      java.lang.String environment,
                      boolean recurse)
               throws AnagramException
Constructor of the MountDirHandle

Parameters:
completeName - the name of this directory in DODS catalog
dir - the file directory handle in the file system
prefix - the prefix for file names
suffix - the suffix for file names
docURL - the documentation URL for this directory
format - the format of data inside this directory, "use" or "jnl"
recurse - if the subdirectory should be considered.

Overrides:
get in class DirHandle
Parameters:
completeName - the complete path name for the specified object

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Tests if the directory is empty. It always returns true so the mounted directory is not deleted even if it is really empty.

Overrides:
isEmpty in class DirHandle

getEntries

public java.util.Map getEntries(boolean recurse)
Returns a Map containing all entries in this directory. The keys are the names of the entries, and the values are the Handle objects associated with those names.

Overrides:
getEntries in class DirHandle
Parameters:
recurse - If true, the Map will also contain all entries in all sub-directories. In this case, handles for the subdirectories themselves will be omitted.
